title: Hiring with ASK: Attitude, Skill, Knowledge
narration: Welcome This video will explore a powerful framework for effective hiring ASK which stands for Attitude Skill and Knowledge. Understanding and prioritizing these three elements can significantly improve your hiring success and build a stronger more capable team.

title: The ASK Framework Explained
content:
Attitude: The candidate's mindset and behavior.
Skill: The candidate's ability to perform specific tasks.
Knowledge: The candidate's understanding of relevant information.
image_desc: Person thinking with gears representing attitude, skill, and knowledge. Type: illustration
narration: The ASK framework emphasizes that a successful employee needs more than just technical abilities. Attitude skill and knowledge are all crucial components. We will delve into each of these aspects exploring how to assess them during the hiring process and why they are important for longterm success.

title: Attitude: The Foundation of Success
content:
Positive mindset and work ethic.
Teamwork and collaboration abilities.
Adaptability and willingness to learn.
Problem-solving approach.
image_desc: Group of diverse people collaborating happily. Type: stock photo
narration: Attitude is often considered the most important element of the ASK framework. A positive attitude strong work ethic and the ability to collaborate effectively are essential for thriving in any team environment. Look for candidates who demonstrate adaptability a willingness to learn and a proactive approach to problemsolving.

title: Skill: Demonstrating Competency
content:
Technical skills related to the job.
Communication and interpersonal skills.
Leadership and management skills (if applicable).
Problem-solving and analytical skills.
image_desc: Person working on a computer, demonstrating technical skills. Type: stock photo
narration: Skills are the specific abilities a candidate possesses to perform the required tasks of the job. When evaluating skills consider both technical and soft skills. Communication interpersonal skills and problemsolving abilities are crucial for success in most roles. For leadership positions assess leadership and management skills.

title: Knowledge: The Required Foundation
content:
Understanding of industry trends.
Familiarity with relevant tools and technologies.
Knowledge of company policies and procedures.
Awareness of legal and ethical considerations.
image_desc: Books and a graduation cap, representing knowledge and education. Type: illustration
narration: Knowledge refers to the theoretical understanding and information a candidate possesses related to the job and industry. Assess their understanding of industry trends familiarity with relevant tools and technologies and awareness of company policies. Also consider their understanding of legal and ethical considerations relevant to the role.

title: Integrating ASK into Your Hiring Process
content:
**Assessing Attitude**
Behavioral interview questions.
Reference checks.
Personality assessments.
**Assessing Skill & Knowledge**
Skills-based assessments.
Technical interviews.
Portfolio reviews.
image_desc: Interview process with interviewer and candidate. Type: stock photo
narration: To effectively use the ASK framework integrate it into your hiring process. Assess attitude through behavioral interview questions reference checks and potentially personality assessments. Evaluate skills and knowledge through skillsbased assessments technical interviews and portfolio reviews ensuring a wellrounded evaluation of each candidate.

title: Conclusion: Building a Stronger Team with ASK
content: Prioritizing Attitude, Skill, and Knowledge leads to better hiring decisions and a more successful team.
image_desc: A diverse team celebrating a success. Type: stock photo
narration: By prioritizing attitude skill and knowledge in your hiring process you can make better hiring decisions and build a stronger more successful team. Remember that a candidate with the right attitude and a willingness to learn can often be more valuable than someone with extensive knowledge but a poor attitude.
